verses.verse: Upright men are astonished at this, And the innocent stirs himself up against the hypocrite.
Yet the righteous will hold to his (Prov. 4:18) way, And he who has (Ps. 24:4) clean hands will be stronger and stronger.
“But please, (Job 6:29) come back again, all of you, For I shall not find one wise man among you.
(Job 7:6) My days are past, My purposes are broken off, Even the thoughts of my heart.
They change the night into day; ‘The light is near,’ they say, in the face of darkness.
If I wait for the grave as my house, If I make my bed in the darkness,
If I say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’ And to the worm, ‘You are my mother and my sister,’
Where then is my (Job 7:6; 13:15; 14:19; 19:10) hope? As for my hope, who can see it?
Will they go down (Jon. 2:6) to the gates of Sheol? Shall we have (Job 3:17-19; 21:33) rest together in the dust?”
Bildad: The Wicked Are Punished Then (Job 8:1) Bildad the Shuhite answered and said:
“How long till you put an end to words? Gain understanding, and afterward we will speak.
Why are we counted (Ps. 73:22) as beasts, And regarded as stupid in your sight?
(Job 13:14) You who tear yourself in anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for you? Or shall the rock be removed from its place?
“The (Job 21:17; Prov. 13:9; 20:20; 24:20) light of the wicked indeed goes out, And the flame of his fire does not shine.
The light is dark in his tent, (Job 21:17; Ps. 18:28) And his lamp beside him is put out.
The steps of his strength are shortened, And (Job 5:12, 13; 15:6) his own counsel casts him down.
For (Job 22:10; Ps. 9:15; 35:8; Is. 24:17, 18) he is cast into a net by his own feet, And he walks into a snare.
The net takes him by the heel, And (Job 5:5) a snare lays hold of him.
A noose is hidden for him on the ground, And a trap for him in the road.
(Job 20:25; Jer. 6:25) Terrors frighten him on every side, And drive him to his feet.
His strength is starved, And (Job 15:23) destruction is ready at his side.
